get.summary: Gets two step verification system metadata.
get.description:
The metadata endpoint takes in optional request parameters to output additional context
for when the user is unauthenticated but attempting to login with two step verification.
            
When supplied, all three request parameters must be sent and match up.

parameters.name: challengeId
parameters.description: The active two step verification challenge ID if there is one.

get.summary: Gets two step verification configuration for the specified user.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The Id of the user to get the configuration for.

parameters.name: challengeId
parameters.description: The active challenge for the user (as an alternative when the user is unauthenticated).

parameters.name: actionType
parameters.description: The action type the challengeId is associated with.

400.description: 1: Invalid challenge ID.

403.description: 2: The user ID is invalid.

get.summary: Gets the current status of recovery codes for a user.

400.description: 2: The user ID is invalid.

401.description: 0: Authorization has been denied for this request.

503.description: 7: Two step verification is currently under maintenance.

the user has properly stored the authenticator key in their authenticator app.

post.summary: Clears any existing recovery codes for the user.
post.description:
Clearing recovery codes voids any recovery codes previously generated for the user.
New recovery codes will have to be generated to pass two step verification via recovery code.

400.description:
2: The user ID is invalid.
4: The password is invalid.

401.description: 0: Authorization has been denied for this request.

403.description:
0: Token Validation Failed
6: The account pin is locked.

503.description: 7: Two step verification is currently under maintenance.

post.summary: Clears any existing recovery codes and generates a new batch of recovery codes.
post.description:
Two step verification recovery codes do not enforce that two step verification must be passed when logging in.
At least one two step verification media type must be enabled to trigger the two step verification flow.
Recovery codes are intended to be used to pass two step verification when the enabled media type is unavailable.
            
Recovery codes generated by this endpoint do not have an expiration.
            
Once a recovery code generated by this endpoint has been used it cannot be used again.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The user ID to generate recovery codes for.

400.description:
2: The user ID is invalid.
4: The password is invalid.

401.description: 0: Authorization has been denied for this request.

403.description:
0: Token Validation Failed
6: The account pin is locked.

503.description: 7: Two step verification is currently under maintenance.

Recovery codes automatically generated for the user (when applicable; the user should
not already have a set of recovery codes).

credentialNickname.description: The nickname of the new credential.

credentials.description: An array of credentials for a user.

twoStepVerificationEnabled.description: Whether or not two step verification is globally enabled.

emailCodeLength.description: Number of characters in an email-based two step verification code.

authenticatorCodeLength.description: Number of characters in an authenticator-based two step verification code.

authenticatorHelpSiteAddress.description: Address of the help site provided to users to help them with authenticator.

isPasswordRequiredForEnablingEmailTwoSte.description: Whether or not a password is required for enabling email 2sv.

isUsingTwoStepWebviewComponent.description: Whether or not we're using the new 2sv webview component or the manual pop up

isTwoStepEnabledRequiredForEmailPassword.description: Whether or not a 2sv method has to be enabled to require password when enabling email two step verification.

isTwoStepEnabledRequiredForAuthenticator.description: Whether or not a 2sv method has to be enabled to require password when enabling authenticator.

isSingleMethodEnforcementEnabled.description: Whether or not the frontend should enforce single method logic.

isSmsTwoStepVerificationAvailable.description: Whether or not sms two step verification is available for the user.

isSecurityKeyTwoStepVerificationAvailabl.description: Whether or not security key two step verification is available for the user.

isAuthenticatorWithVerifiedPhoneEnabled.description: Whether or not someone can enable authenticator with just a verified phone number.

isPasswordRequiredForEnablingSecurityKey.description: Whether or not a password is required for enabling Security Key 2SV.

isPasswordRequiredForEnablingSms2SV.description: Whether or not a password is required for enabling SMS 2SV.

isPasswordRequiredForChangingRecoveryCod.description: Whether or not a password is required for making updates to recovery codes.

isPasswordRequiredForDisablingAuthentica.description: Whether or not a password is required for disabling authenticator.

isPasswordRequiredForDisablingEmailTwoSt.description: Whether or not a password is required for disabling email 2sv.

isPasswordRequiredForDisablingSms2SV.description: Whether or not a password is required for disabling SMS 2SV.

isRecoveryCodeGenerationForAuthenticator.description: Whether recovery code generation is attempted upon completion of authenticator setup.

isSecurityKeyOnAllPlatformsEnabled.description: Whether security keys on all platforms is enabled.

receiveWarningsOnDisableTwoStep.description: Whether users should receive additional warnings when disabling 2SV.
